High-level API for RtMidi

This module provides a high-level wrapper over the rtmidi bindings. The C API for rtmidi is wrapped so you can use either the C or C++ backends.

Usage

Create a MidiIn object to receive MIDI data or a MidiOut object to send data. For both types you can query the devices (ports) available as well as their names. Then open a port to send/receive data.

var dev = midiIn() # midiOut() for output
echo dev.portCount()
echo dev.portName(num)
dev.portOpen(num)
# etc

For receiving data with MidiIn, you can either use a callback to handle the data as soon as it comes in, or poll for it manually. Use setCallback to register the callback, or use recvMidi to receive the message manually. Care is needed when using a callback, as a foreign thread managed by RtMidi will call it.

For sending data with MidiOut, using the sendMidi proc to send an array of bytes to a previously opened port.

Error Handling

The RtMidi C API catches any RtMidi exception and stores its error message. Therefore, none of the procs in this module will raise exceptions. You can check for errors by using the ok proc, which will return false on a Midi object if the last proc called on it caused an error. For example:

if not device.ok:
  stderr.writeLine("midi error: " & device.getError())
  quit(1)

Imports

rtmidi/bindings

Types

MidiApi = enum
  maUnspecified,            ## No specific API / use default
  maMacosxCore,             ## MacOS CoreMIDI
  maLinuxAlsa,              ## Linux ALSA
  maUnixJack,               ## Unix JACK
  maWindowsMM,              ## Windows MultiMedia (winmm)
  maDummy                    ## RtMidi Dummy
Available MIDI backends/providers. Source   Edit   
MidiCallback = proc (timestamp: float64; msg: openArray[byte]) {.thread.}

Callback procedure type for incoming MIDI messages. The thread pragma is attached since this proc is called from a thread that is managed by RtMidi. When using a callback, make sure your procedure is thread-safe.

GC-safety: When using GC, you must ensure this callback does not call any code that uses the GC. If this is unavoidable, then consider using setupForeignThreadGc and tearDownForeignThreadGc. Or use ARC/ORC.

Source   Edit   
MidiError = enum
  meWarning, meDebugWarning, meUnspecified, meNoDevicesFound, meInvalidDevice,
  meMemory, meInvalidParameter, meInvalidUse, meDriver, meSystem, meThread
A category of error that has occurred Source   Edit   
MidiIn = object
  impl*: RtMidiInPtr ## Implementation. Contains a reference to an RtMidiWrapper containing
                     ## an RtMidiIn.
                     ##

MIDI input interface. Allows you to query available MIDI input ports and open one to recieve incoming data from a connected MIDI device.

A destructor is provided that automatically calls rtmidi_in_free. RtMidiIn objects cannot be copied.

Source   Edit   
MidiMsgType = enum
  midiSysex,                ## System Exclusive
  midiTime, midiSense
Special MIDI message types, for filtering incoming data. Source   Edit   
MidiOut = object
  impl*: RtMidiOutPtr ## Implementation. Contains a reference to an RtMidiWrapper containing
                      ## an RtMidiOut.
                      ##

MIDI output interface. Allows you to query available MIDI output ports and open one to send data to a connected MIDI device.

A destructor is provided that automatically calls rtmidi_out_free. RtMidiIn objects cannot be copied.

Source   Edit   
SomeMidi = MidiIn | MidiOut
Type class for some MIDI interface. Source   Edit

    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Ignores the given set of message types. Incoming MIDI messages of an ignored type will not be queued or trigger a callback. Source   Edit

Opens a MIDI port portNum with a given name. Source   Edit   
proc openVirtualPort(dev: var SomeMidi; portName = "RtMidi")
Opens a virtual MIDI port. Only supported on the JACK, ALSA and CoreMIDI backends. Source   Edit

Gets the number of available ports. Source   Edit

proc recvMidi(dev: var MidiIn; msg: var seq[byte]): float64 {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Receive a MIDI message, storing its data into msg. The timestamp of the received message is returned. If there is was no message then msg will be empty. This proc does not block or wait for a message to arrive. Source   Edit   
proc removeCallback(dev: var MidiIn) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Remove a previously set callback. Source   Edit   
proc sendMidi(dev: var MidiOut; msg: openArray[byte]): bool {.discardable,
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Sends a MIDI message out the open port. true is returned on error. Source   Edit   
proc setCallback(dev: var MidiIn; callback: MidiCallback) {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Registers a callback to handle incoming MIDI messages as soon as they arrive. If callback is nil then the callback is removed via dev.removeCallback() Source   Edit
